title: exercise of the powers conferred on us by section 240B of the Defence Act
heading: 1. These Rules may be cited as the Court-Martial Rules 2023.
text_raw: 1. These Rules may be cited as the Court-Martial Rules 2023.

title: exercise of the powers conferred on us by section 240B of the Defence Act
heading: 2. The Court-Martial Rules 2008 to 2011 and these Rules may be cited
text_raw:
2. The Court-Martial Rules 2008 to 2011 and these Rules may be cited 
together as the Court-Martial Rules 2008 to 2023 and shall be construed 
together as one.
text_norm: 2 court-martial rule 2008 2011 rule may cited together court-martial rule 2008 2023 shall construed together one

title: exercise of the powers conferred on us by section 240B of the Defence Act
heading: 3. These Rules shall come into operation on the 2nd day of October 2023.
text_raw: 3. These Rules shall come into operation on the 2nd day of October 2023.
text_norm: 3 rule shall come operation 2nd day october 2023

title: exercise of the powers conferred on us by section 240B of the Defence Act
heading: In these Rules “Principal Rules” means the Court-Martial Rules 2008
text_raw:
4. 

In these Rules “Principal Rules” means the Court-Martial Rules 2008 

(S.I. No. 205 of 2008).
text_norm: 4 rule principal rule mean court-martial rule 2008 (s.i no 205 2008)

title: exercise of the powers conferred on us by section 240B of the Defence Act
heading: 5. The Principal Rules are amended by substituting the following for Rule
text_raw:
5. The Principal Rules are amended by substituting the following for Rule 

82— 

“Record of proceedings– Trial by court-martial
text_norm: 5 principal rule amended substituting following rule 82-- record proceedings- trial court-martial

title: exercise of the powers conferred on us by section 240B of the Defence Act
heading: The Court-Martial Administrator shall record or cause to
text_raw:
82. 

(1) 

The Court-Martial Administrator shall record or cause to 

be recorded the proceedings of a court-martial. 

(2) The record referred to in sub-rule (1) shall include the 

following: 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

(e) 

(f) 

(g) 

(h) 

(i) 

(j) 

the original or a certified copy of the direction of the 
Director to convene a general court-martial or limited 
court-martial or to refer the charge for trial by the 
summary court-martial; 

the original or a certified copy of an order convening the 
court and of any further order in that regard; 

the original or a certified copy of any summons to the 
accused to appear before the summary court-martial; 

the original or a certified copy of any summary or abstract 
of evidence; 

the original or a certified copy of the charge sheet; 

a list of witnesses for the prosecution and defence; 

a list of exhibits; 

any order of the court; 

any order or sentence of the military judge; 

any record, pursuant to sub-rule (3), held by the CourtMartial Administrator. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 13th October, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [492] 

(3) 

(a) The proceedings shall be recorded using any means 
suitable for the making or production of a record within 
the meaning of section 33(3) of the Courts of Justice Act 
1924, as substituted by section 7 of the Criminal Justice 
(Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 1997. 

(b) No person other than the Court-Martial Administrator or a 
person authorised by him or her shall make any record of 
proceedings of a court-martial otherwise than by written or 
shorthand notes. 

(4) The Court-Martial Administrator shall submit the record of the 
proceedings of the trial to the military judge for his or her signature, 
where necessary.”.

title: exercise of the powers conferred on us by section 240B of the Defence Act
heading: Rule 83 and Rule 84 of the Principal Rules are revoked.
text_raw:
6. 

 Rule 83 and Rule 84 of the Principal Rules are revoked. 

 
 
 
 
 [492] 5

title: exercise of the powers conferred on us by section 240B of the Defence Act
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Rules amend the provisions set out in Rule 82 of the Court-Martial 
Rules 2008 in relation to the record of proceedings of a court-martial and 
provide for the revocation of Rule 83 and Rule 84. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [492]
